info.description: This is documentatin for the Node API. For every request you must include in the header: `Content-Type: application/json` Routes with a lock next to them use authorization. In this case, its request-scope JWT tokens in the `Authorization` header coupled with server-side database session persistence. An example secure request would contain the header: `Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ...`
info.title: CryptX System

investment_id.name: investment_id
investment_id.description: identifier of investment run to fetch

get.summary: Default route (ALL VERBS)
get.description: response received when no mathcing route was found for the supplied HTTP verb. While the provided example is a `GET`, this will **work the same on all HTTP verbs**

post.description: Approve cold storage transfer. After approving, system will initiate transfer. The response should be merged with the currently opened deposit.

parameters.description: ID of cold storage transfer

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Coldstorage transfer body

get.description: Fetches list of exchanges.

post.description: Fetches list of exchanges that pass given filter

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Filter object used to filter out data

get.summary: Get list of system settings
get.description: Fetches all system setting values. Settings values are used to customise application without the need to edit code. Key is used as a identifier for that value. Value is actual value that is saved as string but parsed according to type. Type is and constant that represents type of data that value should be parsed into, it can be integer, float, string or boolean.

post.description: This route is for changing single system setting value. To change setting value all is needed is setting ID and value it should be changed to.

parameters.name: setting_id
parameters.description: ID of system setting

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information needed to change system setting

post.summary: Create new instrument that will be used for trading
post.description: Instrument in this system is an asset pair for trading. Instrument consists of two assets, transation asset and quote asset. Freshly created instrument won't be mapped with any of the exchanges so it won't be available for trading at first. Only after mapping instruments with exchanges system will start collecting data for that instrument.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Information needed to create new instrument.

get.summary: Get liquidity requirement information by ID
get.description: Fetches single liquidity requirement information by ID

parameters.name: liquidity_requirement_id
parameters.description: ID of liquidity requirement

get.description: Fetches data of all liquidity requirements

post.description: Fetches data of liquidity requirements that pass given filter

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Filter object used to filter out data

get.summary: Get instrument exchange information by ID of certain liquidity requirement
get.description: Fetches data of exchange by liquidity requirement. It gives information of what exchanges passes the requirement, which of the exchanges lack liquidity, when was the last data update.

parameters.name: liquidity_requirement_id
parameters.description: ID of liquidity requirement

get.description: Get investment run data by id
Get porfolio statistics, such as subscription amount, mci portfolio asset amounts in usd, and market value over time. Month values are supplied in numbers counting from 0.

post.description: Get timeline of investment run by its or any of its related entity ids(investment_run_id, recipe_run_id, recipe_order_id, execution_order_id). Calculates and returns information about investment run. If investment run has no certain type of entities, it will return null value in its position.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: ID of any investment run data to calculate investment run statistics/timeline. Only one of the ID is needed to find investment run. If more IDs are specified, then they will be ignored.

get.description: Get investment run data

post.description: Get investment run data with filtering functionality

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The filter definition to perform on the data set. If absent will assume empty filter and return all data

parameters.description: Recipe run creation body. This can be empty

post.description: After recipe run is confirmed further action is generating recipe orders. This route will help trigger recipe order generation in the system. After orders are generated, next step is approving them. Approved orders will be sent to exchanges.

parameters.description: Body of recipe order generation

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: ID of asset

get.description: Get more detailed information about all assets. This returns many additional values that may not be needed a lot of cases. If functionality doesn't use extra values this route provides please use regular asset information.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The filter definition to perform on the data set. If absent will assume empty filter and return all data

post.description: Create a role by provided name and permission codes. Requires the `perm_alter_user_roles` permission and the `perm_view_roles` permission.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Role creation info

get.summary: Get ifnormation of role by id
get.description: Fetch role by id. Requires the `perm_view_roles` permission

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: identifier of role to fetch

get.summary: Get a list of roles
get.description: The list is optionally filtered when using POST. Requires the `perm_view_roles` permission to fetch.

post.description:
The list is optionally filtered when using POST. Requires the `perm_view_roles` permission to fetch.
All filter keys optional. `prop_name_x` refers to direct data proeprty names, equivalent to use inside of an `AND` block in most cases. 
All `value` keys can be numbers, strings or arrays of the two (`Swagger 2.0` too limiting to show this)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The filter definition to perform on the data set. If absent will assume empty filter and return all data

post.description:
Change makes up the role identified by `role_id`. 
Requires the `perm_alter_role_perm` permission

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: identifier of role to change permissions for

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New Role Information

get.summary: Get a list of all system permissions, grouped by category
get.description: Requires the `perm_view_roles` permission to fetch.

delete.description: Delete information related to role `role_id` in the system. Only allowed if no users are currently using the role. Associated role permissions remain unchanged. Requires the `perm_alter_user_roles` permission.

parameters.name: role_id
parameters.description: identifier of role to delete

post.description: Perform login for specific system user

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Login User

get.summary: Get user info and needed information

post.summary: Send password reset token to email
post.description: Generated password reset info and sends the token with reset link to supplied email.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Reset password email

get.summary: Check password reset token validity
get.description: Called by FE once the user follows the password reset link in their email. If this returns an error, no password reset for them!

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Reset password token

post.description: Called by FE once the user follows the password reset link in their email. If this returns an error, no password reset for them!

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Reset password token

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New user password

get.summary: Get information of user by id
get.description: Fetch user by id. Requires the `perm_view_users` permission, unless viewing yourself (the `me` id)

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: identifier of user to fetch. (Either a numeric database id or the predefined string `me`)

get.summary: Get a list of users
get.description: The list is optionally filtered when using POST. Requires the `perm_view_users` permission to fetch.

post.description:
The list is optionally filtered when using POST. Requires the `perm_view_users` permission to fetch.
All filter keys optional. `prop_name_x` refers to direct data proeprty names, equivalent to use inside of an `AND` block in most cases. 
All `value` keys can be numbers, strings or arrays of the two (`Swagger 2.0` too limiting to show this)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: The filter definition to perform on the data set. If absent will assume empty filter and return all data

get.summary: Get a list of all values for this field in the users view table
get.description: Optionally filtered list of all values for a speicfic field in the users admin view table. Used as the set of options in LOV-type headers. The POST version can be used in conjunction with header search. For users table, this `field_name` can be: `first_name`, `last_name`, `email`, `is_active`

parameters.name: field_name
parameters.description: name of column field to fetch LOV for. corresponds to value used to fill column by entity.

post.summary: Get a list of all values for this field in the users view table
post.description: Optionally filtered list of all values for a speicfic field in the users admin view table. Used as the set of options in LOV-type headers. The POST version can be used in conjunction with header search. For users table, this `field_name` can be: `first_name`, `last_name`, `email`, `is_active`

parameters.name: field_name
parameters.description: name of column field to fetch LOV for. corresponds to value used to fill column by entity.

parameters.name: filter query
parameters.description: the query used to additionally filter the LOV

post.description: Change the roles user has in system

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: identifier of user to fetch. (Either a numeric database id or the predefined string `me`)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New User Roles

post.description: Change the name/active status of user and password if supplied. To change password, old password must be supplied also. Other properties ignored, absent are merged. Requires the `perm_edit_users` permission.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: identifier of user to fetch. (Either a numeric database id or the predefined string `me`)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New basic user information (all properties except for `first_name`, `last_name`, `is_active` and `new_password` are ignored)

post.description:
Change the password current user uses to login. 
Invalidates all active user sessions except for the current one

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: identifier of user to fetch. (Either a numeric database id or the predefined string `me`)

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: New User password

post.description: Create an invitation and send it via email. The invitation `token` enforces the supplied user role, first name and last name. Requires the `perm_create_users` permission.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Create User Invitation

post.description:
Used by the FE app once the user clicks the link with the token in their email. The FE app should then extract that token from the query parameters and send to this endpoint to receive detailed invitation info and fill in the blanks for the user.
This method will also check invitation validity.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: User invitation token

post.summary: Create a new user by using an invitation object
post.description: Create a user from data in hte identified invitation. The invitation integrity is ensured before the creation takes place. New user does not get auto logged in.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Create User By Invitation

post.description: Create a user from provided data. Does not auto-login created user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Create User

delete.description: _Soft Delete_ a user in the system by setting their `is_active` flag to `false`. Can be used to deactivate yourself as well. Requires the `perm_delete_users` permission.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: Identifier of user to delete

post.summary: Get a list of all values for this field in the cold storage table
post.description: Optionally filtered list of all values for a speicfic field in the cold storage view table. Used as the set of options in LOV-type headers. The POST version can be used in conjunction with header search. For users table, this `field_name` can be: `first_name`, `last_name`, `email`, `is_active`

parameters.name: field_name
parameters.description: name of column field to fetch LOV for. corresponds to value used to fill column by entity.

parameters.name: filter query
parameters.description: the query used to additionally filter the LOV

details.example: Jane Morren changed status to Completed

InvestmentPortfolioStats.description: Get portfolio statistics. Month vallues are supplied as a numbers starting from 0.

InvestmentRunTimeline.description: Statuses and statistics on investment run

ExchangeList.description: Fetches distinct values of table column. Should help implement filtering.

Exchange.description: Fetches distinct values of table column. Should help implement filtering.

ColumnLOV.description: Fetches distinct values of table column. Should help implement filtering.

SystemSettingChange.description: Request body to change single system setting

setting_value.description: It can take anything - string, number, boolean. It will be parsed in the back-end according to what type of value it's set to be.

SystemSetting.description: Single system setting data. Key is used as a identifier for that value, and they are use in in code. Value is actual value. Type is and constant that represents type of data, it can be integer, float, string or boolean.

LiquidityRequirementExchangesResponse.description: List of exchanges for certain liquidity requirement.

LiquidityRequirementExchanges.description: List of exchanges for certain liquidity requirement.

LiquidityRequirementResponse.description: Servers response with basic instrument information.

LiquidityRequirementCreate.description: Create liquidity requirement for instrument and exchange (by providing exchange ID) or all exchanges (by providing 'all') in exchange property

InstrumentExchangeMapExpanded.description: Servers response with basic instrument information.

InstrumentExchangeMapResponse.description: Servers response with basic instrument information.

InstrumentExchangeMap.description: Servers response with instrument information that includes price, trading volume.

last_updated.description: Gives timestamp of when was the last data update for this instrument & exchange

InstrumentAddMappingResponse.description: Response of successful recipe order status change

InstrumentAddMapping.description: Map multiple instruments with exchanges through array of exchange mapping data

InstrumentCheckMapping.description: Request data need to map instrument with exchange

InstrumentGetResponse.description: Servers response with basic instrument information.

InstrumentGet.description: Servers response with basic instrument information.

InstrumentResponse.description: Servers response with basic instrument information.

ExecutionOrderFill.description: Information of single fill for excution order

ApproveDepositInfo.description: Parameters for approving a pending deposit

RecipeOrderAlterResponse.description: Response of successful recipe order status change

RecipeOrderAlterRequest.description: Parameters needed to approve or reject recipe order

comment.example: Approve this recipe order group because...

recipe_stats.description: Statistics of how much orders, execution orders and deposits recipe run has.

RecipeRunCreateRequest.description: Request body for recipe run creation

approval_comment.example: I approve this recipe run because...

AssetChangeStatus.description: Change asset status - blacklist or whitelist. Blacklisting an asset means it won't be considered in future recipe runs.

AssetDetailedListResponse.description: Server response with array of detailed asset information

AssetDetailedResponse.description: Server response with detailed asset information

AssetListResponse.description: Example of a response where list of assets are returned

AssetResponse.description: Example of server response when asset is retured

Asset.description: Asset, in other words - cryptocurrency, that is used in system for trading purposes.

AssetStatusChangeHistory.description: Single entry of asset status history.

CreateInvestmentRun.description: Fill out investment run information to start investment run.

AuthCheckResponse.description: User, his permissions, and model constants information that will be used to change number values to user friendly values.

PermissionsList.description: List of permissions user has. Some of the values might repeat.

EntitiesFilter.description: Entity filter. Scoped to a `filter` key to easily combine with other POST data.

order.description: Set order to return results in. Can sort by multiple properties. Property "by" specifies property/values to sort by, and "order" specifies in what order that property should be sorted (asc - ascending / desc - descending)

type.description: Specifies what type of value is given for filtering. If you want to send timestamp, you have to send type timestamp, otherwise it back-end will use timestamp as string to compare agains dates.

total.description: total number of permissions in system

message.example: <Some message depending on endpoint context. Not intended for parsing, provides general information to human readers>
